summary: (3e)-3,7-dimethylocta-1,3,6-triene and jasmonate are related through their roles in plant defense mechanisms and signaling pathways. The context discusses the emission of volatile organic compounds (VOCs) in response to methyl jasmonate (MeJA) treatment, which includes jasmonate as a signaling molecule. The presence of (3e)-3,7-dimethylocta-1,3,6-triene among the emitted compounds suggests it may play a role in the plant's response to stress, potentially acting in concert with jasmonate to enhance defense against pathogens like G. cichoracearum.
